comment: Ambiguous expectations, no clear grading mechanism, not much helpful. Very dangerous if we do big projects or papers. I did not want take risk and withdrew.

This is the worst class that I have ever taken in my at Kennesaw State. There are only 7 grades in the class, 3 tests, 3 assignments and 1 project.The lectures are low quality and unlearnable from, the slides are filled with useless information that conveys nothing. Every test is a challenge because the tests ask questions that no one knows the ans

My biggest gripe with this professor is his tests. The questions are written such that there seem to be many correct answers. The online class is not allowed to use a notes sheet when the inperson class can. Does not communicate that you will need and that you can use a calculator and scrap paper to work out the problems involving math. Avoid!

His teaching methods are horrible. He reads word for word from the lecture slides and goes over very ew examples. He expects you to use the examples from the slides to study for your test rather than actually teaching the material. Any questions you ask outside of class will be responded to with very smart remarks without giving a clear answer.

A great and fair professor. He offered a generous number of bonus points, would replace your lowest test grade with the highest, and allows a cheat sheet on every test. Also, his lectures are nice and he always encourages students to ask questions. While exams can be difficult to prepare for, it's not a problem for the reasons previously mentioned.

I really want to like him, but his teaching style is really bad.Reads of lecture slides - sprinkles in some examples - but really, you have to teach yourself everything. Very nice guy, though. I suggest talking with him after class whenever you can to help yourself; he likes that too. Make sure to study the text book - you can find it free online.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 3 tests(55%), 3 programming assignments (35%), attendance(10%). Lectures are hundreds of slides, but you just need to follow the study goal given at the beginning of each module. In fact, you just need to understand the main concepts instead of trying to memorize the slides. Takes the best out of your 3 tests as one mark and curves if necessary.

this a hole took over our class after professor left the school mid semester and completely ruined the grading scale. threw out multiple quizzes/extra credit and made the grades depend on 2 projects and final. Rude, Unavailable, Useless professor. Changing grading scale shouldn't be allowed..mainly midsemester!!! its DEC 2nd..still NOTHING GRADED

3 tests(35%), 3 programming assignments (25%), and 1 semester-long project (40%). Lectures are hundreds of slides, very unorganized, and hard to read and understand. 10-20 question tests and the average was always in the 50s and 60s. Go ham on the semester-long project, it can save your grade. He curved like hell the final grade.

Powerpoints are hundreds of slides long, lectures are just him reading the powerpoint so expect to tech yourself everything. Assignments are vague and difficult, tests are difficult, cover far too much content. The only reason anyone passes this class is because he curves everything, which wouldn't be necessary if everything was less vague.

This professor is by far one of the worst professors i have taken. He has three assignments with vague instruction. He takes over a month to grade homework. His lectures also consist of him reading power point slides word for word. He doesn't have a clear schedule and gives 1-2 week notice of when the next test is as well as homework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: If you take him, be prepared to learn everything on your own. He replied to emails very slow and replies were very vague. His lectures are powerpoints and videos of him reading the powerpoints. 3 assignments, 3 tests, and they were hard. Final project is 40% of grade so try to do the best on it. Id take someone else instead of him.

Would not recommend online. No lectures or videos, only reading material (book and ppts with 100+ slides), which makes it very hard to learn AI. Grading seems almost random, giving 100s to people with unfinished work and 50s to people with finished. He's very helpful if you can go to his office though. Tests are hard but not impossible.

Show up to his office hours, even if just for homework, and make a small amount of conversation with him. His homework is easy to bs, as he really just makes sure that it runs, but I always felt that they were great exercises for learning the material. If you pay attention to class and exercises, tests/your grade will go well for you.
His tests were difficult and he can sometimes be a little cryptic but he's ok if you simply show some effort and talk to him if you fall behind.   Also, go HAM on that final reportproject.

Hung is great- his tests are hard in that you need to understand concepts from class well enough to handle challenging problems, but you learn a hell of a lot. He really forces you to understand rather than memorize. You may need to read the chapters about ten times each but dang will you be good when you are through!

Difficult to understand his accent. Speaks very quietly which makes it VERY hard to understand in a large room. Follows the book and power points, very little teaching and sharing of knowledge. VERY VERY nice person, but not a great professor.

The professor can't explain during his lectures too well, but emailing him does wonders. He's extremely nice, and gives students chances over and over to do well. I had a 30 something in his class but made a C on his final, and passed the class~

Not an easy subject to begin with, and the language barrier doesn't help, but his PowerPoint slides are great and communication through e-mail is what saved me. I was taking an intro class and he forgot that it was an intro class, but once you explain your difficulties,(I sent copies of my programs to him), he can explain.

First off, this man is ridiculously smart. He seems to lose touch with his students struggles at times. But if you remain engaged with him, answer questions, contribute to the lecture, etc, he tends to be more inclined to help you. Study, a lot, and show up every day and you should do fine.

Worst teacher I've had at SPSU.  Difficult to understand his English, not interested in helping, pretty much on your own to learn anything in this class.  Nice guy, horrible instructor.  Avoid his class if possible.
No knowledge what he is teaching, doesn't know how to talk in english, hard to communicate with

Teacher did not have a good setup for projects. Due dates and grades were unclear. Teacher is difficult to understand and does not explain well. Teacher does understand students' difficulties and is not very willing to help. Teacher does not prepare student for tests. Tests are very hard, grades were extremely poor and always had to be curbed.
Will never take another class with this professor again. The worst experience ever.
No Comments
